intro: Planchonella yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan native glory, is a small evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
